thread.title: Highlands ready for next soccer showdown, this time with Montclair
thread.title_full: Highlands ready for next soccer showdown, this time with Montclair

title: Highlands ready for next soccer showdown, this time with Montclair
text:
Highlands ready for next soccer showdown, this time with Montclair October 5, 2015, 3:39 PM Last updated: Monday, October 5, 2015, 3:49 PM By Staff report Print 
Northern Highlands has grown accustomed to playing big games. 
On Tuesday, the Highlanders face yet another when the two best teams in the state meet in a 4 p.m. girls soccer showdown. 
Northern Highlands, the nation’s No. 1-ranked team, travels to Montclair – No. 3 in the country, according to TopDrawerSoccer.com. 
Last month, the Highlanders (9-0) beat nationally-ranked Maria Carrillo (Calif.), 3-1, behind Georgetown-bound midfielder Casey Richards (a goal and an assist). They have won four consecutive Group 3 championships. 
Montclair (9-0) has won 22 straight games and captured the Group 4 title last season. 
Neither team has lost a game since 2013. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
